I've played this game on and off since it was released. I would regularly take months to years long breaks from the game because it was so hard to have fun with the game, and every time I came back the game was even less fun than before. I love the aesthetic of the game and it's the main thing that kept me coming back. But every time I take a break, I just fall further and further behind in the meta. I don't see spending money to buy new killers to unlock the newest strongest perks as a worthwhile investment when the game is so unfun. So then I just continue to fall even further behind. There doesn't seem to be any actual matchmaking, so going against a team of survivors that spend every waking moment playing the game and communicating to bully me and any other killer unlucky enough to get matched against them. And dead hard is an absolute misery to play against. You can outplay them enough to down them and they get a free pass that you had no way to predict or counter outside of exhaustion add-ons on a few of the killers I don't have all to counter a single perk. And those I do have I don't have leveled, because I can't get fair matches to play them and get used to them without getting blood points on other killers that I happen to have max leveled with okay-ish perks. It's a terrible cycle every which way you look at this game. And playing survivor isn't much better, getting paired up with a pre-made team that doesn't care about you and is content to feed you to the killer, or teammates that have no grasp on how to play the game. I wanted to like the game throughout the years, but it's so horribly designed from the ground up that I just can't bother anymore.

Survivor boring and killer frustrating

Why bad?

1.Survivor sided game (I played both side)
2.No balance between killers
3.Pay to win killers
4.Devs don't care about balance only about money 
5.Extremely low progress if you don't put money in the game 
6.Shitty matchmaking (is there any?)
7.Survivor use the same perks over and over
8.You get so little content by buying this game that it feels like Free-to-play formula.

,............And the list goes on but I don't have all day................

Alright, I'm a new player, just started, and I must say that I do really like this game. It just might be my newest addiction. It is buggy, yes, still needs some tweaking, and the people you're in a match with may be far less than friendly sometimes. But still, I think the pros outweigh the cons. No longer will I just be watching YouTubers play; I'll be actively playing myself! I'm not very good at it; frankly, I suck more than a baby with a pacifier, but I still have lots of fun, even though I lose. I'll never give up, never! I'll be a queen someday! A low-graphics queen, but still a queen nonetheless! You'll see! Maybe!

Also, The Trickster? My soulmate. My actual soulmate. I'm so in love with him, I can't even see straight, not that I'm exactly straight anyways. Anyone who plays as him will have my favor. You can kill me and I won't be the slightest bit upset. Promise.

Now, if you'll excuse me, it's time to go shooping for some more DLC packs. This sale's too good to miss!

Only bad thing is the toxic community but when you're playing in a group with 4-5 friends in Custom Games that alone makes it worth the purchase.
